title: New Fertilizer Subsidy Scheme for Tea and Cinnamon Farmers
summary: The government has introduced a new subsidy scheme to provide affordable fertilizers to tea and cinnamon farmers in rural Sri Lanka, aiming to increase production and reduce costs.

title: Boosting High-Quality Cinnamon Cultivation
summary: A new cinnamon-focused development department is promoting intercropping and GI certification to enhance cinnamon quality and marketability.

title: Sri Lanka Aims to Double Cinnamon Export Revenue
summary: The government plans to increase export revenue to USD 500M by expanding cultivation and producing value-added cinnamon products.

title: Cautious Growth Projected for 2025
summary: Sri Lanka's tea industry is expected to grow modestly in 2025, producing around 280 million kg. Key factors include climate, fertilizer costs, and increased mechanization.

title: Farmers Tour to Sri Lanka 2025
summary: A group of farmers from various countries is scheduled to visit Sri Lanka to explore sustainable practices in tea and cinnamon cultivation, learning directly from local farmers.

title: Tea Export Reaches $1.43 Billion in 2024
summary: Sri Lanka's tea exports in 2024 reached 245.7 million kilograms, generating $1.43 billion in revenue, showing a slight increase compared to the previous year.
